home.title: Applied Longevity — Premium 1-on-1 Longevity Coaching
home.description: Evidence-based longevity coaching for 3–5 clients at a time. Training, nutrition, sleep, emotional health, and medical metrics — all tailored to you.

about.title: About the Founder
about.description: 15+ years of serious training, a CAIA designation, and a psychology background — meet the analyst-turned-coach behind Applied Longevity.

pillars.title: Five Pillars of Longevity
pillars.description: Training, nutrition, sleep, emotional health, and medical metrics — five pillars integrated into one evidence-based longevity protocol.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.description: A three-phase process: 4 weeks of baseline observation, methodical protocol building, and ongoing optimization. See how Applied Longevity coaching works.

hero.title: A private longevity advisory.
hero.subtitle: Quiet, thorough attention to your health — personal and ongoing.
hero.microline: Three to five clients at a time.

capacity.title: 3–5 clients at a time.
capacity.body: This work requires presence — not templates, not delegation. A deliberately small number of clients means each person receives the depth, continuity, and privacy that this kind of collaboration requires.

items.title: Understanding where you are
items.description: Before anything changes, we listen. Four weeks of quiet, private observation — sleep, movement, nutrition, bloodwork, daily rhythms — to understand your health on its own terms.

items.title: A framework built around you
items.description: From your baseline, we shape a structured approach across five dimensions — movement, nutrition, sleep, emotional well-being, and medical data — held between us and built for your life as it is.

items.title: Continuous refinement
items.description: Your protocol evolves with you. Through ongoing private conversation, we refine what needs refining — at a pace that respects your time and attention.

about.title: About
about.body:
My background spans psychology, analytics, and over fifteen years of studying how health holds together across its many dimensions. I've worked closely with individuals whose lives leave little room for trial and error — people who need clarity, not more information.

I take on very few clients and stay involved over long periods. Each engagement begins with careful observation, not intervention. The goal is to understand your patterns before shaping anything — and to remain a steady, discreet presence as your health evolves.

items.title: Tracking hardware included
items.description: The right wearables and sensors, selected and configured for you. No research required on your end.

items.title: Your personal dashboard
items.description: All your health data in one place — private, reviewed by me personally. Every number comes with context and meaning.

items.title: Weekly clarity
items.description: A short, focused summary each week: what's working, what's shifting, what comes next. Nothing unnecessary.

pillarsPreview.title: The Five Pillars
pillarsPreview.subtitle: Each pillar is part of a system — none stands alone.

items.title: Movement
items.summary: Strength, endurance, and mobility — built to sustain you.

items.title: Nutrition
items.summary: Nourishment that supports your energy — without restriction.

items.title: Sleep
items.summary: The foundation of clarity, recovery, and resilience.

items.title: Emotional Well-being
items.summary: What holds everything together — especially during transitions.

items.title: Medical Data
items.summary: Bloodwork, biomarkers, and the clarity that comes from knowing.

cta.title: When you're ready.
cta.body: A brief, private conversation to understand what you're looking for. No preparation needed — just honesty about where you are.

hero.title: Five pillars
hero.body: Longevity isn't one thing — it's five things working together. We address each pillar individually and as part of an integrated system.

items.title: Training
items.description: Strength, cardiovascular fitness, mobility, and recovery — programmed as one integrated system. We design training around your schedule, injury history, and long-term structural goals. The aim is to build a body that performs well at 40, 60, and beyond.

items.title: Nutrition
items.description: We take a data-informed approach to nutrition — no ideology, no fads. We track biomarkers, body composition, and subjective energy to find the dietary pattern that supports your training, cognitive performance, and metabolic health.

items.title: Sleep
items.description: Sleep is the single highest-leverage variable for health and performance. We use wearable data and subjective logs to optimize sleep architecture — not just duration, but the quality and consistency of each stage.

items.title: Emotional Health
items.description: Stress, relationships, purpose, and psychological resilience are not separate from physical health — they are foundational to it. We address the mental and emotional dimensions of longevity with the same rigor we apply to training and nutrition.

items.title: Medical & Metrics
items.description: We work with your medical team to track the biomarkers that matter. Comprehensive bloodwork, advanced imaging when appropriate, and longitudinal tracking give us an objective view of how your body is responding to the protocol.
details: DEXA, coronary calcium, and other imaging

cta.title: See how it all fits together
cta.body: Every pillar reinforces the others. The result is a protocol that compounds over time.

hero.title: How it works
hero.body: Every engagement follows the same three-phase structure. We observe before we act, build methodically, and consolidate for the long term.

phases.title: Observe
phases.description: We don't change anything yet. For four weeks we collect baseline data — sleep architecture, training logs, nutrition patterns, bloodwork, and subjective well-being. This gives us a clear picture of where you are before we touch a single variable.

phases.title: Build
phases.description: With a solid baseline in hand, we introduce changes one layer at a time across the five pillars. Each intervention is tracked and measured so we know exactly what's working. We move deliberately — stacking changes only when the previous layer has stabilized.

phases.title: Consolidate
phases.description: Once the core protocol is in place, we shift to maintenance and optimization. Regular check-ins, periodic re-testing, and seasonal adjustments keep you progressing without burning out. This is where the long game lives.

steps.title: Submit your application
steps.description: Fill out a brief form telling us about your goals, current health status, and what you're looking for in a coaching relationship.

steps.title: Introductory call
steps.description: If there's a good fit, we'll schedule a 30-minute call to discuss your situation in more detail and answer any questions.

steps.title: Onboarding & baseline
steps.description: Once we begin, you'll receive access to our tracking tools and start the 4-week observation phase right away.

hero.title: Testimonials
hero.body: Hear from clients who have been through the process. These are placeholder testimonials — replace them with real stories as they come in.

items.quote: The 4-week baseline period seemed slow at first, but it completely changed how I understood my own body. The data we collected gave us a roadmap I never could have built on my own.
items.name: James R.

items.quote: I've worked with trainers and nutritionists before, but never someone who looked at all five dimensions together. The integration is what makes this different.
items.name: Sarah M.

items.quote: What I appreciate most is the patience. No rushed changes, no dramatic overhauls. Just steady, evidence-based progress that I can actually sustain.
items.name: David K.

items.quote: The sleep optimization alone was worth it. My deep sleep went from 45 minutes to nearly two hours, and everything else improved downstream — mood, training recovery, focus.
items.name: Maria L.

items.quote: I was skeptical about the emotional health pillar, but it turned out to be the missing piece. Managing stress properly unlocked progress in every other area.
items.name: Tom W.

items.quote: Having someone who actually reads my bloodwork, understands my training data, and connects it all together — that level of attention is rare. The small roster makes a real difference.
items.name: Elena P.

cta.title: Join them
cta.body: When a spot opens, we'll review your application and reach out to schedule a call.

hero.title: Built from experience, not theory.
hero.subtitle: Applied Longevity grew out of 15+ years of training, self-experimentation, and coaching the people closest to me — combined with the reality of building companies and navigating a demanding career. I believe the best protocol is one that makes your life better, not smaller.

story.title: Background
story.p1: I've been a committed athlete for over 15 years — competitive sports, strength training, endurance work, and everything in between. Along the way I started coaching friends and colleagues, initially just sharing what I'd learned. Over time, that turned into something more structured.
story.p2: Professionally, I've founded two companies and now work in Private Equity. I know what a demanding schedule looks like — the early mornings, the travel, the mental load that never fully switches off. That experience shaped my conviction: health has to fit into your real life, not replace it.
story.p3: Through my <link>research on leadership</link>, I saw firsthand how the right guidance can positively shape human behavior and development — how people grow when someone meets them where they are and holds them accountable with care. That insight is what drew me to coaching, and it's the foundation of how I work today.
story.p4: The question that drives me: what does it actually take to stay strong, sharp, and healthy — not for months, but for decades? The answer isn't a single protocol or biohack. It's a system — one that integrates training, nutrition, sleep, emotional health, and medical data into a coherent whole. That's what Applied Longevity is.

callout.title: My Approach
callout.body: Health should enrich your life, not restrict it. We find a way that fits your everyday — without giving up what brings you joy.

observe.title: Observe before you act
observe.description: Every engagement starts with four weeks of baseline data collection. We don't change anything until we understand where you actually are — not where you think you are.

roster.title: Small roster, deep work
roster.description: I work with 3–5 clients at a time, for a minimum of six months. This is not scalable by design. Real coaching requires real attention.

evidence.title: Evidence over ideology
evidence.description: No fads, no tribal nutrition wars, no magic supplements. We track what works with objective data — bloodwork, wearables, fitness benchmarks — and adjust accordingly.

life.title: More life, not less
life.description: Health should increase your well-being without decreasing your joy of life. We find a way to integrate better habits into your life — not strip away what makes it worth living.

sustainable.title: Sustainable by default
sustainable.description: The goal is a protocol you can maintain for years, not a 12-week transformation. We build habits and systems that compound, not crash.

cta.title: Want to work together?
cta.subtitle: If this resonates, apply below. I read every application personally.

hero.title: Begin a conversation.
hero.body: This is not a sales form. It's a short, reflective exchange to help us understand what you're looking for — and whether this advisory is the right context for it. Every response is read personally and held in confidence.

next.title: What follows

steps.title: I read your inquiry personally
steps.description: There is no automated screening. I read every response myself to understand your situation, your priorities, and what kind of support you're looking for.

steps.title: A private conversation
steps.description: If it feels like the right fit for both sides, I'll suggest a brief, unhurried call. No pitch — just an honest exchange about where you are and what might help.

steps.title: A considered beginning
steps.description: If we decide to work together, we begin with four weeks of quiet observation. No changes, no pressure — just a careful look at where your health stands today.

next.note: I respond to every inquiry within a few days. If I'm at capacity, I'll let you know honestly and we can revisit when the timing is right.
